events.name: May Special Meetup with Adrian Mahieu
events.description: Agenda  • Introduction & Announcement  • "I've got a bee in my bonnet about the craziness of purely managing by risk" by Adrian Mahieu  • Networking  I've got a bee in my bonnet about the craziness of purely managing by risk Adrian will talk about the meshing of privacy and security, and how it can all go horribly wrong. And why managing purely by risk is the way to insanity and lead to drinking way too much kopi. About Adrian Mahieu - CEO & Co-Founder Cortex Insight. 15+ years working within the security function of industries and understands the business side of security. Building, running companies and events and consulting for over 20 years in a number of vertical sectors and start-ups. Started the European distributor for Immunity Inc. (alien8 Security) and Co-Founder and Event Director of 44CON. MSc Information Security from Royal Holloway, 1999.
events.location: 1 Raffles Quay, EY (Ernst & Young), North Tower, Level 14, 1 Raffles Quay (048683), Singapore, Singapore
events.group_name: Null Singapore - The Open Security Community

events.name: Singapore SharePoint Community May Meetup
events.description: Utilizing AI and Chat Bots in the Modern Intranet Dave Enright will share with us how modern intranets can be brought to the next level with the use of Artificial Intelligence and Chat Bots. Speaker Bio Dave Enright has been an IT professional for over 15 years, in a wide range of roles spanning solution architecture, consulting, systems administration, and development. He has worked for professional services companies ranging from start-up size to large corporation, and has worked with clients that have been equally diverse. The last few years he has been focused heavily on integrating and delivering cloud technologies in both Azure and Amazon, and developing custom solutions for cloud platforms, such as micro services hosted in Azure and custom Office 365 applications.Before joining Telstra, Dave worked at Kloud (a Telstra subsidiary) in Australia and was a senior consultant and people leader. There he worked on projects ranging from SAP integration with SharePoint Online to cloud strategy consulting aimed at helping companies transition into the cloud. For one company in the resourcing sector, he built a reskinned SharePoint portal that stored over 200,000 employee records for a global workforce. Along with making employee records easy to store and find, the portal was integrated with SAP, and also had workflows that streamlined HR and payroll processesDave was part of the team that won a Golden Quill award for Intranet excellence in 2015.
events.location: Microsoft Singapore - 22BR-01, 1 Marina Boulevard #22-01 One Marina Boulevard Singapore 018989

events.name: Carousell Level-Up: Applying Scrum for Better Delivery Part 3.
events.description:
We're on week 3 of our Level-Up series of Scrum talks, and this week we'll be focusing on two very important elements of Scrum: Sprint planning and running daily scrums. With better knowledge on how to properly execute these, you'll be well on your way to sharpening up our Scrum skills

Topic: Scrum Fundamentals, Pt 3
Presenters: Jordan Dea-Mattson, Carousell VP of Engineering
Date and time: 2 May 2017, 7pm onwards
Address: 240 Tanjong Pagar Road, #12-00 Keppel Tower 2, Singapore 088540

These weekly talks have been lots of fun so far, and we've found the crowds very engaging with lots of insightful and hilarious discussions about Scrum. So, if you’re working in engineering, product management, or just in defining and delivering products, you should come and join our talk! Food and drink will be provided, as well as good company! Hope to see you here!
events.location: Carousell HQ, 240 Tanjong Pagar Rd, #12-00, Singapore 088540

events.name: A VR Feast for Developers, Creators, Businesses & Enthusiasts
events.description: Whether you're a developer, a content creator, an enthusiast or exploring business applications in VR & AR, there's something for you at this Meetup. Our guest speakers share their first-hand knowledge of AR/VR from very different perspectives: a potential tool for future projects, use-cases in advertising and beyond, lessons from developing Google Daydream & Tango and creating content for a mass audience. Evening Rundown 7.00pm - Welcome by AsiaVR team Our host for the evening is Don Anderson (https://www.linkedin.com/in/donjanderson), Co-Founder of AsiaVR Association and Head of Family & Learning Partnerships, YouTube APAC 7.15pm - Ng Siau Yong (https://www.linkedin.com/in/siau-yong-ng-31b36012/), Singapore Land Authority & Ronnie Lee, GovTech Virtual Singapore Explained Virtual Singapore (https://www.nrf.gov.sg/programmes/virtual-singapore) is a 3D city model that is an accurate representation of Singapore. It is a joint effort by the National Research Foundation, Singapore Land Authority and GovTech. Apart from being used by government agencies, there is also potential for the private sector to leverage on the model for various types of uses. 7:35pm - Dean Reinhard (https://www.linkedin.com/in/deanreinhard/), Creative Technology Director (APAC), iris Worldwide Creating VR content for non-gaming applications Dean and his team create VR projects for events, marketing and industrial uses. In addition to his role at advertising agency iris Worldwide (http://www.iris-worldwide.com/), Dean is CTO in a range of ventures focused on VR, AR and data. He'll talk about some of the use cases for these technologies and bring a demo for everyone to try. 7:55pm – Sami Kizilbash (https://www.linkedin.com/in/samikiz/), Developer Relations Program Manager, South & Southeast Asia, Google Lessons learned in the development of Google Daydream and Tango Sami oversees Google’s Developer Relations activities in South & Southeast Asia and acts as the VR/AR point-of-contact for DevRel Ecosystem outreach globally. He has led tech and media ventures at small startups and software giants alike. Early in his Google career, Sami helped lead the company’s market entry into South Asia’s emerging countries. He'll talk about his learnings in the development of Google Daydream and Tango. 8:15pm – Q&A with Shanmuga Sundaram, Producer, Channel News Asia The Making of ‘Unreal to Real’ - a Channel News Asia documentary about VR Shan is a passionate filmmaker that has done a variety of work in Los Angeles, India and Singapore. He was recognized by the Media Development Authority of Singapore (MDA) with a full overseas scholarship. He was the first Singaporean to successfully produce and release a feature film in over 200 screens in India, Sri Lanka and Singapore. Presently, a Producer in Channel News Asia making Virtual Reality content and documentaries. Be sure to check out Unreal to Real on Toggle here (https://video.toggle.sg/en/series/unreal-to-real-the-making-of-virtual-reality/ep1/484246). 8:35pm - Announcements: Upcoming events & Opportunities. Community announcements. If you have anything to share that would be of value to the community, you're welcome to take a minute to do so. 8.40pm – Showcase & networking We encourage everyone who’d like to demo their work to bring it to the event to showcase. It’s a chance to exchange feedback, advice, best practices and make connections. The more sharing the better. We aim to include time and space to do this at all future meet-ups. THIS IS A FREE EVENT (Live Broadcast viewable in our Facebook group - TBC) About AsiaVR Association The AsiaVR Association is a non-profit association focused on promoting dialogue, debate and collaboration in this rapidly evolving area of technology innovation. Our members come from a wide variety of disciplines, including user interface and application development through to VR documentary filmmaking and branded content creation. We welcome anyone interested in contributing to the discussion, or just wanting to come up to speed on this exciting new area, to join us. Do join our discussion in our Facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/asiavr/
events.group_name: AsiaVR Association - Singapore Virtual Reality Meetup Group
